overview: From 2025-10-12 to 2025-10-19, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 12 new PRs (4 merged), 1 new issues, and 22 active contributors.

topIssues.title: rollup-boost partial healthiness tolerance
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body: An opt-in tolerance for the partial healthiness failures of op-rbuilder in op-conductor so as to ignore one-off harmless blips in op-rbuilder.

topIssues.title: Deploy rollup-boost partial healthiness tolerance
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body: Roll this setting to the devnet -> sepolia -> mainnet to have it in action.

topIssues.title: op-conductor flashblocks-streaming and raft timeout issues
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
Identify the root cause behind the issue of conductor trying to forward flashblocks from rollup-boost.

One of the identified issues has been

```
"error reading from rollup boost WebSocket" err="failed to read: read limited at 32769 bytes"
```

Moreover, there had been sporadic issue around conductor raft p2p timeout expiring causing it to transfer leadership despite no unhealthiness.

[Example]([https://optimistic.grafana.net/a/grafana-lokiexplore-app/explore/service/op-conductor/lo[…]sage=false&sortOrder=%22Ascending%22&wrapLogMessage=false](https://optimistic.grafana.net/a/grafana-lokiexplore-app/explore/service/op-conductor/logs?patterns=%5B%5D&from=2025-10-12T01:57:00.000Z&to=2025-10-12T01:59:00.000Z&var-lineFormat=&var-ds=grafanacloud-logs&var-filters=service_name%7C%3D%7Cop-conductor&var-filters=network%7C%3D%7Cmainnet-prod&var-filters=app_kubernetes_io_instance%7C%3D%7Cprod-mainnet-op-opn-geth-f-sequencer-1&var-fields=&var-levels=&var-metadata=&var-jsonFields=&var-patterns=&var-lineFilterV2=&var-lineFilters=&timezone=browser&var-all-fields=&displayedFields=%5B%5D&urlColumns=%5B%5D&visualizationType=%22logs%22&prettifyLogMessage=false&sortOrder=%22Ascending%22&wrapLogMessage=false))

topPRs.title: op-deployer: fix, support, test upgrades up to v4.1.0
topPRs.author: bitwiseguy
topPRs.body:
# Overview

* Updates the superchain-registry/validation package import so that it includes standard `op-contracts/v4.1.0` addresses.
* Ports support for `op-deployer upgrade v4.1.0` from [this pr](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17790) that was made against `proposal/op-contracts/v4.1.0`
* Fixes bug in upgrade commands that use contracts `tag://`
* Adds CLI level integration tests for `upgrade` commands

# Tests

Uses existing cli runner to invoke `upgrade` commands via cli interface. Test implementation steps:
* target standard opcm address based on `op-contracts` tag
* fork sepolia at `blockNum = (opcmDeploymentBlock) + 1`
* using op-sepolia contract/role addresses, attempt `op-deployer upgrade`

topPRs.title: feat(op-conductor): add replica_id label for multi-replica monitoring
topPRs.author: CreeptoGengar
topPRs.body:
Add replica_id label to health check metrics to distinguish between multiple replica instances in the same namespace. 

- Add --replica-id CLI flag with env var support
- Update health check metrics with replica_id label
- Maintain backward compatibility with default replica_id="default"
- Add unit tests for new functionality

Fixes #17686

topPRs.title: proofs: Pass game type as a CWIA arg instead of a constructor arg
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

V2 fault dispute game contracts no longer take the game type as a constructor arg, allowing a single FaultDisputeGame deployment to be used for both cannon and cannon-kona.  DisputeGameFactory passes the game type as part of the CWIA args automatically.

The change is feature toggled with the game type only being passed through if the game args added in creator pattern are non-zero length.  So existing IDisputeGame implementations are unaffected.

**Tests**

Updated tests.

**Additional context**

Builds on https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17782

**Metadata**

#17260

topPRs.title: op-dispute-mon: Consider node invalid if it has not processed L1 past the game head
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Update op-dispute-mon so that it checks the rollup node sync status and considers it invalid if `CurrentL1` is not above the game's L1 head block number. This ensures that the node's safe head correctly reflects the L1 data used in the game and ensures that out of sync nodes are ignored. If all nodes are out of sync it is considered a fetch failure.

Conveniently this also means that when a node falls behind, rather than raising an alert because games resolved incorrectly, it will report that op-dispute-mon is failing to update games correctly which is much less scary and misleading.

**Tests**

Added unit tests.

**Additional context**

Alternative to https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17825

**Metadata**

Part of #17814 - will also need to update the super_agreement_enricher with equivalent logic before calling this completed done.

topPRs.title: refactor(test): improve ResourceMetering test coverage and quality
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
# refactor(test): improve ResourceMetering test coverage and quality

## Summary

This PR improves the `ResourceMetering.t.sol` test file by:

1. **Converting duplicate tests to fuzz test**: Replaced 3 duplicate tests (`test_metered_updateOneEmptyBlock_succeeds`, `test_metered_updateTwoEmptyBlocks_succeeds`, `test_metered_updateTenEmptyBlocks_succeeds`) with a single fuzz test `testFuzz_metered_updateEmptyBlocks_succeeds` that tests block differences from 1-100. This provides broader coverage while reducing code duplication.

2. **Reorganizing test contracts**: Reordered test contracts to match the source contract's function declaration order:
   - `ResourceMetering_Metered_Test` (tests `metered` modifier at line 66)
   - `ResourceMetering_ResourceMeteringInit_Test` (tests `__ResourceMetering_init` at line 168)

**Net change**: -22 lines of code (59 insertions, 81 deletions) with improved test coverage.

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] Verify the fuzz test `testFuzz_metered_updateEmptyBlocks_succeeds` properly covers the same scenarios as the original 3 tests (bounded 1-100 blocks)
- [ ] Confirm test contract order matches source function declaration order (metered modifier → init function)
- [ ] Run tests locally to verify all pass: `just test-dev --match-path test/L1/ResourceMetering.t.sol -v`

### Notes

- All tests passed (10 passed, 0 failed, 1 skipped)
- Pre-PR validation passed with 0 semgrep violations
- No functional changes to test logic, only consolidation and reorganization

---

**Link to Devin run**: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/f1b80be40ec3484ca620f146f11e965a  
**Requested by**: Ariel Diaz (@aliersh)

completedItems.title: op-dispute-mon: distinguish 404 from output root not found
completedItems.body: After adding multi-node support we need to treat an output root not found differently from a transport-level 404 error.
